member.name: T:UnixText.Program
member.summary: Converts a Windows text file into one suitable for consumption on a Unix or Linux machine.

remarks.para: Examines one or more text files specified on the command line for Unicode UTF-8 byte order marker (BOM) as well as Windows style CR-LF line endings. If any of these are present, the file will be rewritten stripping out the (BOM) and converting to Unix style (LF only) line endings with the file being generated using the UTF-8 encoding.
When no files are specified, the tool simply process standard input and writes the converted text to standard output.
remarks.note: File name wildcards may be specified.
remarks.para: The -r option specifies that folders should be walked recursively to process any matching files.

member.name: M:UnixText.Program.Main(System.String[])
member.param: The list of files to be processed with optional wildcards.

member.name: M:UnixText.Program.Exit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Exits the program returning the specified process exit code.

member.name: M:UnixText.Program.ProcessInput
member.summary: Process the standard input and writes the result to standard output.

member.name: M:UnixText.Program.ProcessFile(System.String)
member.summary: Processes a file by removing the Unicode byte order mark, if present, and converting CR-LF sequences into LF, if there are any.
member.param: Path of the file to be processed.
member.returns: true if the file needed to be modified.
